im.r_c.android.dbox

Class DBox<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • im.r_c.android.dbox.DBox<T>

  • public class DBox<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    Provide a bunch of methods for saving, removing, finding objects, etc.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean clear()
      (CAUTIOUS!!) Remove all objects.
      boolean drop()
      (CAUTIOUS!!) Drop the table of this box and all mapping tables entirely.
      DBoxQuery<T> find(DBoxCondition condition)
      Find objects of a class that satisfy a specific condition.
      DBoxQuery<T> findAll()
      Find all objects of a class.

      Initialize DBox.
      static <T> DBox<T> of(java.lang.Class<T> clz)
      Obtain a DBox object of a class.
      boolean remove(T obj)
      Remove an object (must have an id).
      boolean save(T obj)
      Save or update (if already exists) an object.

        databaseName - filename of database

      • of

        public static <T> DBox<T> of(@NonNull
                             java.lang.Class<T> clz)
        Obtain a DBox object of a class.
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of objects the box can handle
        Parameters:
        clz - class that represents a table
        Returns:

        public DBoxQuery<T> findAll()
        Find all objects of a class.
        Returns:
        query object

      • find

        public DBoxQuery<T> find(DBoxCondition condition)
        Find objects of a class that satisfy a specific condition.
        Parameters:
        condition - condition (aka where clause)
        Returns:
        query object

      • save

        public boolean save(T obj)
        Save or update (if already exists) an object.

        This will change the object's id if the object does not exist before or it has been removed by clear() or drop().

        Parameters:
        obj - object to save
        Returns:
        succeeded or not

      • remove

        public boolean remove(T obj)
        Remove an object (must have an id).

        After removing, the object's id will be set to 0.

        Parameters:
        obj - object to remove
        Returns:
        succeeded or not

      • clear

        public boolean clear()
        (CAUTIOUS!!) Remove all objects.

        After a box being cleared, re-saving previous objects with non-zero ids of the corresponding class will give them new ids.

        Returns:
        succeeded or not

      • drop

        public boolean drop()
        (CAUTIOUS!!) Drop the table of this box and all mapping tables entirely.

        After a box being dropped, re-saving previous objects with non-zero ids of the corresponding class will give them new ids.

        Returns:
        succeeded or not
